H0.text: Aphasia is the medical term for the inability to use or understand what, resulting from damage to the brain. Speech

H1.text: Aphasia is the medical term for the inability to use or understand what, resulting from damage to the brain. Memory

H2.text: Aphasia is the medical term for the inability to use or understand what, resulting from damage to the brain. Motor Skills

H3.text: Aphasia is the medical term for the inability to use or understand what, resulting from damage to the brain. Lnguage

A4.text: Aphasia, also known as dysphasia, is an impairment in a person's ability to comprehend or formulate language because of dysfunction in specific brain regions.

A5.text: In particular, people with aphasia often demonstrate short-term and working memory deficits.

A6.text: Patients with IPL damage have also been observed to exhibit both speech production errors and impaired working memory.

A7.text: Patients with damage to the MTG-TP region have also been reported with impaired sentence comprehension.

A8.text: aphasia (difficulty with verbal expression, auditory comprehension, reading and writing; Broca's or Wernicke's area typically involved)
